verses.kjv: Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king’s heart was toward Absalom.
verses.ct: Joab son of Zeruiah noticed that the king's thoughts kept turning to Absalom.

verses.kjv: And Joab sent to Tekoah, and fetched thence a wise woman, and said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on now mourning apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead:
verses.ct: So Joab sent someone to Tekoa and brought back a clever woman. He told her, "Please pretend to be in mourning. Wear clothes for grieving, don't put on any perfume, and act like someone who has been mourning a death for a long time."

verses.kjv: And come to the king, and speak on this manner unto him. So Joab put the words in her mouth.
verses.ct: "Then go to the king and say exactly what I tell you." And Joab coached her on what to say.

verses.kjv: And when the woman of Tekoah spake to the king, she fell on her face to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, Help, O king.
verses.ct: When the woman from Tekoa came before the king, she dropped to the ground and bowed low, then cried out, "Please help me, your majesty!"

verses.kjv: And the king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, I am indeed a widow woman, and mine husband is dead.
verses.ct: The king asked her, "What's wrong?" She replied, "I'm a widow — my husband is dead."

verses.kjv: And thy handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and there was none to part them, but the one smote the other, and slew him.
verses.ct: "Your servant had 2 sons, and they got into a fight out in the field. There was no one around to break it up, and one of them struck the other and killed him."

verses.kjv: And, behold, the whole family is risen against thine handmaid, and they said, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him, for the life of his brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the heir also: and so they shall quench my coal which is left, and shall not leave to my husband neither name nor remainder upon the earth.
verses.ct: "Now the whole clan has turned against your servant, demanding, 'Hand over the one who killed his brother so we can execute him for taking his brother's life.' They want to eliminate the heir too. This would snuff out the only ember I have left and leave my husband with no name or descendant on the earth."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto the woman, Go to thine house, and I will give charge concerning thee.
verses.ct: The king told the woman, "Go home. I'll issue an order on your behalf."

verses.kjv: And the woman of Tekoah said unto the king, My lord, O king, the iniquity be on me, and on my father’s house: and the king and his throne be guiltless.
verses.ct: But the woman from Tekoa said to the king, "My lord the king, let the blame fall on me and my father's family. Let the king and his throne be innocent."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Whosoever saith ought unto thee, bring him to me, and he shall not touch thee any more.
verses.ct: The king said, "If anyone gives you trouble, bring him to me, and he won't bother you again."

verses.kjv: Then said she, I pray thee, let the king remember the LORD thy God, that thou wouldest not suffer the revengers of blood to destroy any more, lest they destroy my son. And he said, As the LORD liveth, there shall not one hair of thy son fall to the earth.
verses.ct: Then she said, "Please, let the king swear by the LORD your God that the avengers of blood won't cause any more destruction, so they don't kill my son." He replied, "As surely as the LORD lives, not a single hair of your son's head will fall to the ground."

verses.kjv: Then the woman said, Let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak one word unto my lord the king. And he said, Say on.
verses.ct: The woman said, "Please let your servant say one more thing to my lord the king." He replied, "Go ahead."

verses.kjv: And the woman said, Wherefore then hast thou thought such a thing against the people of God? for the king doth speak this thing as one which is faulty, in that the king doth not fetch home again his banished.
verses.ct: The woman said, "Then why have you planned something similar against God's people? By making this ruling, the king convicts himself, because the king has not brought back his own banished son."

verses.kjv: For we must needs die, and are as water spilt on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again; neither doth God respect any person: yet doth he devise means, that his banished be not expelled from him.
verses.ct: We all must die — we're like water poured out on the ground that can't be collected again. But God doesn't just take away life; instead, he makes a way for the outcast not to remain permanently cut off from him."

verses.kjv: Now therefore that I am come to speak of this thing unto my lord the king, it is because the people have made me afraid: and thy handmaid said, I will now speak unto the king; it may be that the king will perform the request of his handmaid.
verses.ct: "The reason I came to say this to my lord the king is that the people made me afraid. Your servant thought, 'I'll speak to the king — maybe the king will grant his servant's request.'"

verses.kjv: For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid out of the hand of the man that would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.
verses.ct: "Because the king would listen and rescue his servant from the man trying to wipe out both me and my son from God's inheritance."

verses.kjv: Then thine handmaid said, The word of my lord the king shall now be comfortable: for as an angel of God, so is my lord the king to discern good and bad: therefore the LORD thy God will be with thee.
verses.ct: "Your servant thought, 'The word of my lord the king will bring relief.' Because my lord the king is like an angel of God in telling right from wrong. May the LORD your God be with you."

verses.kjv: Then the king answered and said unto the woman, Hide not from me, I pray thee, the thing that I shall ask thee. And the woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.
verses.ct: Then the king responded and said to the woman, "Don't hold anything back from me when I ask you something." The woman said, "Let my lord the king ask."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Is not the hand of Joab with thee in all this? And the woman answered and said, As thy soul liveth, my lord the king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from ought that my lord the king hath spoken: for thy servant Joab, he bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of thine handmaid:
verses.ct: The king asked, "Is Joab behind all of this?" The woman answered, "As surely as you live, my lord the king, there's no getting around what my lord the king has said. Yes, it was your servant Joab who instructed me. He put every one of these words in your servant's mouth."

verses.kjv: To fetch about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.
verses.ct: "Your servant Joab did this to present the situation in a different way. But my lord has wisdom like the wisdom of an angel of God, knowing everything that happens in the land."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go therefore, bring the young man Absalom again.
verses.ct: The king said to Joab, "All right, I'm granting this. Go and bring the young man Absalom back."

verses.kjv: And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and bowed himself, and thanked the king: and Joab said, To day thy servant knoweth that I have found grace in thy sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath fulfilled the request of his servant.
verses.ct: Joab dropped to the ground, bowed low, and thanked the king. Joab said, "Today your servant knows that I have earned your favor, my lord the king, because the king has granted his servant's request."

verses.kjv: So Joab arose and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: So Joab left for Geshur and brought Absalom back to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king said, Let him turn to his own house, and let him not see my face. So Absalom returned to his own house, and saw not the king’s face.
verses.ct: But the king said, "He may return to his own house, but he is not to come into my presence." So Absalom went back to his own house and did not see the king.

verses.kjv: But in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Absalom for his beauty: from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him.
verses.ct: In all of Israel, no one was as widely admired for his appearance as Absalom. From head to toe, there wasn't a single flaw on him.

verses.kjv: And when he polled his head, (for it was at every year’s end that he polled it: because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he polled it:) he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels after the king’s weight.
verses.ct: Whenever he cut his hair — which he did at the end of every year because it got so heavy — the hair from his head weighed 200 shekels by the royal standard.

verses.kjv: And unto Absalom there were born three sons, and one daughter, whose name was Tamar: she was a woman of a fair countenance.
verses.ct: Absalom had 3 sons and 1 daughter. His daughter's name was Tamar, and she was a very beautiful woman.

verses.kjv: So Absalom dwelt two full years in Jerusalem, and saw not the king’s face.
verses.ct: Absalom lived in Jerusalem for 2 full years without being allowed into the king's presence.

verses.kjv: Therefore Absalom sent for Joab, to have sent him to the king; but he would not come to him: and when he sent again the second time, he would not come.
verses.ct: Absalom sent for Joab, wanting him to go to the king on his behalf, but Joab refused to come. He sent a second time, and Joab still refused to come.

verses.kjv: Therefore he said unto his servants, See, Joab’s field is near mine, and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire. And Absalom’s servants set the field on fire.
verses.ct: So Absalom told his servants, "Look, Joab's field is right next to mine, and he has barley growing there. Go set it on fire." So Absalom's servants set the field ablaze.

verses.kjv: Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom unto his house, and said unto him, Wherefore have thy servants set my field on fire?
verses.ct: Joab immediately went to Absalom's house and demanded, "Why did your servants set my field on fire?"

verses.kjv: And Absalom answered Joab, Behold, I sent unto thee, saying, Come hither, that I may send thee to the king, to say, Wherefore am I come from Geshur? it had been good for me to have been there still: now therefore let me see the king’s face; and if there be any iniquity in me, let him kill me.
verses.ct: Absalom answered Joab, "I sent word to you saying, 'Come here so I can send you to the king with a message: Why did I bother coming back from Geshur? I would have been better off staying there.' Now let me come into the king's presence. And if I'm guilty of something, let him execute me."

verses.kjv: So Joab came to the king, and told him: and when he had called for Absalom, he came to the king, and bowed himself on his face to the ground before the king: and the king kissed Absalom.
verses.ct: So Joab went to the king and relayed the message. The king summoned Absalom, and he came and bowed with his face to the ground before the king. Then the king kissed Absalom.
